item.title: iPod Integration Journey: From Dream to Modular Architecture (2002-2003)
item.description: The iPod Phenomenon and the Integration Dream In May 2002, Apple’s iPod was just a year old but already reshaping how people thought about digital music. At Motorola, we faced a critical question: how do we integrate iPod functionality into mobile devices? The vision was seductive: your phone would be your music player. Not two devicesâ€”one elegant handset that played music, made calls, managed contacts, and did everything in between. What followed was over a year of iterative development that fundamentally shaped my understanding of modular systems and scalable architecture.
